🔴Court resumes for Derek Chauvin's murder trial in Minneapolis today

🇺🇸Joe Biden was watching the proceedings "closely", the White House said.
 
The US president's spokeswoman said the events surrounding Mr Floyd's death were a reminder of the need to make "addressing racial injustice a priority to the things we do."

A large group of protesters gathered outside the courthouse as the trial began.
 
📌 Some sold t-shirts and caps saying “I can’t breathe”, a reference to Mr Floyd’s last words
📌 Some of the crowd filled the road waving their “Black Lives Matter” flags

🎙️Outside the courthouse in downtown Minneapolis, Mr Floyd's family said they were prepared for the defence to attempt to "assassinate" his character.
 
They signalled the trial would have broader implications for America

📌 Nelson said there was "more to the scene" than the bystander footage showed, citing that Mr Floyd would not co-operate during his arrest.
 
"Derek Chauvin did exactly what he had been trained to do over his 19-year career," he said

🔴 Prosecution opening arguments 
 
Prosecutor Blackwell began by detailing how Chauvin knelt on Mr Floyd's neck for a total of 9 minutes and 29 seconds as the unarmed black man said "I can't breathe" 27 times
